bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas and Lydia Cabrera, March 12, 1952

div1.p: Hench expresses concern about the recent Cuban revolution. He describes his visit with Rath and Grant of the National Trust, and informs Rojas that he suggested to Rath that he visit the Finca San Jose in order to advise her and Cabrera on preservation efforts.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas and Lydia Cabrera, March 12, 1952
div1.opener:
March 12, 1952
Senora Maria Teresa Rojas
Senorita Lydia Cabrera
Finca San Jose
Calzada Real y Gomez Redencion
Quemados de Marianao
Havana, Cuba
Dear friends:
div1.p:
The radio news of yesterday morning is quite disturbing. I am amazed that
such a thing can happen with so little interference. I do hope that the
democratic processes survive in Cuba. Incidentally, how do you think this
change will effect our own hopes and plans regarding Camp Lazear?

I had a very nice visit with Mr. Frederick L. Rath, Director, National
Council for Historic Sites and Buildings, 712 Jackson Place, N.W., Washing-
ton, D. C. I also met the President of the Council, General Grant,
grandson of the famous general. He was very interested in both projects,
that regarding Camp Lazear and in particular about your own problem.
While he had no immediate solution, he had some very good ideas and it
is my opinion that he could help you very definitely, if not specifically
through American help he can aid by giving you the proper advice as to
how to go about developing a similar organization in Cuba.

Incidentally, Mr. Rath is speaking in St. Petersberg, Florida in a few
weeks. I think he would be willing to fly over to Havana and spend a
couple of days with you if you should like to have him do so. I think
he could do this without expense to you. On the other hand, the cost of
the trip would be personal. Would you want him enough to be able to
entertain him at your house for a couple of days? He is a very pleasant
young man. He will be in Florida about the week of April 28. If you
think he could help you by making a trip to Havana, may I suggest that
you either write him directly or, if you prefer, let me know and I will
write him.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
